oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Report and Testimony of the Select Committee of the United States Senate to Investigate the Causes of the Removal of the Negroes from the Southern States to the Northern States, Part III
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: United States Congressional Serial Set, 46th Congress, 2d Session, Senate Report 693, Pp. 383 & 384, 24 cm.

In 1880 the U. S. Senate appointed a committee to investigate the causes of black migration from the South. Benjamin Singleton was one of the persons called to testify before the committee, and presented his reasons for encouraging the migration.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Singleton, Benjamin "Pap"; Singleton, "Pap"; Migration--African-American; Convention--African-American; Exodusters
